Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that there is a poster in front of Rahul Gandhi in a shop that says "No lending till the time Rahul Gandhi becomes the PM." However, it is later revealed that the poster was digitally superimposed on the original image.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a digitally manipulated image. The original image, as well as tweets from individuals present at the event, suggest that the poster in the shop was unrelated to Rahul Gandhi becoming the PM.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the poster in the shop is genuine and reflects the views of the shop owner. However, it is later revealed that the poster was digitally added to the image, raising questions about its authenticity.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the poster in the shop was unrelated to Rahul Gandhi becoming the PM. The original image and tweets suggest that the poster listed items available at the store, not a political message.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the poster in the shop was digitally superimposed on the original image. The original image and tweets provide evidence that the poster was unrelated to Rahul Gandhi becoming the PM.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting a manipulated image as evidence without verifying its authenticity. It fails to provide accurate information about the poster in the shop.
Understate: There is no evident understatement bias in the claim.
